greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sum of base-9 digits of a(n-1) + sum of base-9 digits of a(n-2).
comment: The digital sum analog (in base 9) of the Fibonacci recurrence. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 27 2007

a(n) and Fib(n)=A000045(n) are congruent modulo 8 which implies that (a(n) mod 8) is equal to (Fib(n) mod 8) = A079344(n). Thus (a(n) mod 8) is periodic with the Pisano period A001175(8)=12. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 27 2007
For general bases p>2, we have the inequality 2<=a(n)<=2p-3 (for n>2). Actually, a(n)<=13=A131319(9) for the base p=9. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 27 2007

formula: Periodic from n=3 with period 12. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Mar 13 2006
